vocabInfos.lsjDefs:
μακρο-θῡμέω,
to be long-suffering, ἐπί τινι towards one, [LXX+NT]
__2 to be slow to help, [NT]
__3 persevere, [Refs 1st c.AD+]
__4 with accusative, bear patiently, [LXX] bear up! [Refs 2nd c.AD+]
vocabInfos.shortDef: to have patience; to be patient; to exhibit internal and external control in a difficult circumstance, which control could exhibit itself by delaying an action
vocabInfos.mediumDef:
to have patience; to be patient; to exhibit internal and external control in a difficult circumstance, which control could exhibit itself by delaying an action
to be slow towards, be long-enduring; to exercise patience, be long-suffering, clement, or indulgent, to forbear, Mt. 18:26, 29; 1Cor. 13:4; 1Thess. 5:14; 2Pet. 3:9; to have patience, endure patiently, wait with patient expectation, Heb. 6:15; Jas. 5:7, 8; to bear long with entreaties for deliverance and avengement, Lk. 18:7*
vocabInfos._es_Definition: tener paciencia, ser paciente, esperar pacientemente ; tal vez: ser lento para ayudar o tardarse en ayudar (LUC.18:7)
vocabInfos._zh_tw_Definition:
1) 有耐心, 等候
2) 忍耐, 承受
3) 延遲 (路 18:7)
vocabInfos._zh_Definition:
1) 有耐心, 等候
